channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023070369
item.description:
Report X-2023070369

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: BELCAMP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/11/2023 at approximately 1525, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 780470 at international hub in KÃ¶ln, Germany, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 8 fiberboad boxes, each with one metal can inside. One of the shipments was discovered to have leaked onto one other shipment. The cause of the spillage was undetermined. German policy on spills requires a call to the fire brigade, who then took possession of the both the leaking package and the affected pakcage.

item.title: Report X-2023070393
item.description:
Report X-2023070393

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LAUREL
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AN UNLOADER DISCOVERED A LEAKY SMELLY PACKAGE NEAR THE REAR DOOR OF TRAILER. THE LOADER NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR WHO THEN CALLED FOR A RESPONDER TO ADDRESS THE MATTER. THE RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PE AND A DECISION TREE IN HAND. THE RESPONDER CONTAINED THE SPILL, CLEANED UP THE AREA AND SECURED THE DAMAGED PACKAGE IN A SPILL TRY FOR TRANSPORT TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING.
